comment: This is an example settings file. A settings file MUST be called 'settings.json'.
comment2: Settings file must be in the same folder as the executable.
_comment_graphics_folder: Configure the game's graphics folder location here. This is where the images will be saved to.
_comment_graphics_folder2: On Windows, you can use either a slash ('/') or two backslashes ('\') to separate folders. This applies to every setting in all configuration files.
_comment_source_folder: This is the folder where the script looks for images.
_comment_templates: You can define and re-use instructions with templates.
_comment_templates2: The options for templates are the same as for creating instructions directly.
_comment_instructions: This portion defines how the source images are processed before saving to the game's graphics folder.
_comment_instructions2: Note that any paths written in _config.json's override, include or exclude lists must have processing instructions defined here.

default-behaviour._comment: These are the default values for each setting.
default-behaviour._comment_opacity: How opaque the image should be. 1.0 results in no transparency, 0.0 creates fully transparent pictures.
default-behaviour._comment_trim: Determines whether the image is trimmed when resizing to fit the target size. More details on this later.
default-behaviour._comment_padding: Settings 'padding_top', 'padding_bottom', 'padding_left' and 'padding_right' take space from the image and replace it with transparency (for png images) or black (for jpg images).
default-behaviour._comment_padding2: Note that they do not add to the total size of the image. Instead, the space for the padding is taken from the picture.
default-behaviour._comment_extension: You can define the file extension for all images that are saved in this folder.
default-behaviour._comment_extension2: Do not write the preceeding dot (e.g. write 'png' instead of '.png').
default-behaviour._comment_extesion3: Value 'null' means that the same extension is used as in the source image.
default-behaviour._comment_extension4: Currently supported extensions are png, jpg, and jpeg. The extensions are case-insensitive.
default-behaviour._comment_mask: The setting 'mask' allows you to blend the image with another image. More details on this later.

instructions._comment: The keys in instructions are directory paths inside the game's graphics folder. The complete path is graphics_folder + key.
instructions._comment2: The keyword {folder} is special. It gets replaced by the source image's folder name, unless set otherwise in a _config.json file.

backgrounds/clubs/{folder}._comment_width: The maximum horizontal space in pixels that the image should take.
backgrounds/clubs/{folder}._comment_height: The maximum vertical space in pixels that the image should take.
backgrounds/clubs/{folder}._comment_trim: Let's say we have an image the size of 3191px x 1803px.
backgrounds/clubs/{folder}._comment_trim2: If trim was set to false, the source image would be resized to 1024px x 579px, preserving the full picture.
backgrounds/clubs/{folder}._comment_trim3: When 'trim' is set to true, the source image would first be shrinked to the size of 1359px x 768px,
backgrounds/clubs/{folder}._comment_trim4: and then pixels would be removed from left and/or right according to the image's 'image_centre_x' setting defined in _config.json to fit the target dimensions of 1024px x 768px.

mask._comment_image: The relative path to the image you want to use as the mask.
mask._comment_image2: I highly recommend setting the extension and having a mask image of same format.
mask._comment_opacity: The opacity of the mask image.
mask._comment_opacity2: The value of 0.0 means that the source image would be unaltered by this setting, and 1.0 would make replace the source image entirely by the mask image.

instructions._comment3: You can reuse the same instructions by calling its template name, defined above in the 'templates'.
